ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Unique identifier of cells
A controlled vocabulary describing the cell type
Notes: 1=astrocyte; 2=B-lymphocyte; 3=CD138(plus) cell; 4=CD8(plus) T-cell; 5=cultured neuronal cell from olfactory neuroepithelium (CNON); 6=dopaminergic neuron; 7=epithelial; 8=epithelial-like; 9=GABAergic neuron; 10=glia; 11=glial progenitor cell; 12=glutamatergic neuron; 13=hematopoetic; 14=immune cell; 15=lymphoblast; 16=macrophage; 17=mesenchymal cell; 18=microglia; 19=monocyte; 20=monocyte-derived microglia; 21=NeuN-; 22=NeuN(plus); 23=neural stem cell; 24=neuronal-intermediate progenitor cell; 25=oligodendrocyte; 26=peripheral blood mononuclear cell; 27=radial glia cell; -99=Other

ElementDescription: Other specific cell type not listed
Subtype of cell type specifying more detail of cell type morphology
Number of cells or organoids per well
Number of cells or organoids per experiment
Description of the protocols used in the assay
Reference to a paper describing procedure.
Description of conditions used to grow or maintain organisms or cells prior to extract preparations
Cell culture substrate for modified cells.
Cell culture media for modified cells.
Passage method for modified cells.
Passage reagent for modified cells.
Passage number of cells at the starting point
Format of the plate/well/slide, if applicable
Other format for plate/well/slide
Layout of the plate/well/slide, if applicable
Description of treatments applied to biological material prior to extract preparations
What mutation/treatment group does this specimen belong to?
List/description of pharmacological agents used in the study
Description of protocols used to extract and prepare the material to be sequenced
Method used to generate cell suspensions
Molecule extracted from biological material
Other molecule extracted from biological material
